website_summaries.verdict: A FIDO-certified USB scanner that can be carried on a key ring.
pros: A small scanner with 360-degree detection and compatibility with browsers and cloud utilities
Compatible with the iDOO Mini USB and with Windows Hello and Windows 7, 8, and 10
cons: Some customers reported issues with the scanner's website password functionality

customer_reviews.title: Great Technology and at a Reasonable Price
customer_reviews.text: Microsoft put some effort into its interface with this type of product. Kensington made a product that works to MS specs. The discrimination at failed attempts seems just about right to me and I thank MS for this.I would like a product that has some ergonomic consideration for the angle of the hand and fingers as reading print is critical to get alignment and a positive read when contact is made. Secondly, this security measure is so convenient, I am ready for it to be more widely used on Web sites and elsewhere for the quickest and most secure access.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Disintegranted after 2 months of use
customer_reviews.text: Was somehow tricky to install. For some reason it couldn't read fingerprints about 50% of time. After number of just plain install/uninstall drivers it got better and detection moved up to 90%. Unfortunately, I couldn't enjoy it for long, because it disintegrated after about 2 months of use (see the picture). That front piece that holds it together just fell down and it's not possible to clip it back, because it apparently broke and not disconnected
customer_reviews.author: ighost

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy for the password keeping functionality..
customer_reviews.text: Works well with Windows Hello, but if you want to use the proprietary verimark password software for websites, etc., save your time. Most of the time the program itself won't launch, and when it does, it only remembers some website's passwords. After it saves those website's passwords it only allows you to use it some of the time. Tried and tested on 6 different computers.
customer_reviews.author: Mike O

customer_reviews.title: Poor Design!
customer_reviews.text: There are about 15 steps to install this overpriced Fingerprint reader, ridiculously too much! It should've a CD and auto-install, esp for this price. It's easily double the price of nearly all other fingerprint readers. And the tech support is lousy, no number is listed and when you get through to someone, it's tech support in India, which is hard to hear and hard to understand.
customer_reviews.author: Bigmac

customer_reviews.title: Works 100% of the time so far
customer_reviews.text: Got a new laptop for work recently with a fingerprint reader, but have the laptop going through a dock and the cover is closed all of the time so I wasn't able to use built-in fingerprint. Picked up this reader and paired it with a Desktop USB Extension Cable ( and it's worked great for the past month or so that I've had it. You do need to re-image your fingerprints once you install it, but when you log in it just requires a finger press, not a swipe (not that it's a big deal). Happy with my purchase and it was at a decent price.
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: Good 360 degree fingerprint reader, 100% compatible with Win 10. Price is too high.
customer_reviews.text: I like this fingerprint reader quite a bit. The laptop this is attached to has a fingerprint reader next to the trackpad, but I use it docked with the lid closed. This works extremely well for that purpose. The added keychain cover is nice as well. Quick reads from any direction and very discreet, which is appreciated. The only thing I don't like is the price. It's much more expensive than it's competitors, for no reason, as they use the same tech. I'd buy it, only if you need the discreet color, rather than the bright silver of the competing product.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Smith

customer_reviews.title: Worked for 3 months. Failed. VeriMark Customer Service is a joke
customer_reviews.text: Device failed within 3 months. Wasted over 2 hours on VeriMark chat playing with drivers and their software. Hardware failure. They promised to issue a replacement. Instead, got an email saying they are out of stock and directing me back to Amazon. Amazon Customer Service asks for Denial of Service Letter from the manufacturer before they can issue a replacement. All this wasted time for one crappy fingerprint reader.
customer_reviews.author: enature

customer_reviews.title: Works really well. Better than the one built into laptop
customer_reviews.text: This fingerprint reader works fantastically. Works leaps and bounds better than the one built into the touchpad of my laptop (Sager NP8377) which is disappointing because the fingerprint reader was one of the biggest reasons I got this model over another one that was a little cheaper. It works with Windows Hello as well as desktop password managers like OmniPass to use biometrics for login to websites. I personally prefer programs like OmniPass over single sign on programs. I prefer to have to swipe my fingerprint when I want to login to a site, versus swipe once at the beginning of my browsing session and then every password is put in for me.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Lambert

customer_reviews.title: Lightening-fast sign in with your finger, just like with your phone (except maybe faster).
customer_reviews.text: Lightening-fast sign in with your finger, just like with your phone (except maybe faster). It's so fast, it'll make you think there's no LED indicator showing when your PC is expecting you to provide a fingerprint. (But there IS an LED, a nice blue one that's not too bright.) However, there is a missed opportunity with this kind of device. If there were a button on the device that would wake your PC before you sign in, like many power buttons on some Android devices and Windows devices, that would be ideal. So I'd just have to press the fingerprint reader once - waking the PC and signing in - all in one motion.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew G.

customer_reviews.title: Works great with Windows 10 and RoboForm
customer_reviews.text: I've been using RoboForm for many years and they've always recommended the Verify P2000. I've bought several of those over the years, but they have some driver issues, are kind of pricey, and are a little slow at taking a reading. I needed a new reader and decided to take a chance on something different. This reader worked right out of the box and is very fast. No finger swiping is needed - just a quick tap with your fingertip. I also like that it has a blue LED that lights up when an app is waiting for you to tap it. I'll be buying these from now on.
customer_reviews.author: S. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Incredible
customer_reviews.text: I have an ASUS laptop without a webcam. No Windows Hello. This is an awesome way to add biometrics to a computer in an affordable way. It's super easy to set up, plug it in, go into settings, and you're pretty much good to go. Took me less than two minutes! It's really small as well, so you can leave this attached to any device without worrying about it taking up too much space or looking unsightly. So far, no downsides. It gets me into my computer nice and fast and I'd recommend this to anyone with a computer missing Windows Hello.
customer_reviews.author: lorentz

customer_reviews.title: Worked well but fell apart
customer_reviews.text: I was impressed with this small fingerprint reader as it had a small form factor and worked well. Unfortunately one week after the 30 day return period, it fell apart. Cheap plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Mystery

customer_reviews.title: Fails more often than not
customer_reviews.text: Pretty much every time I go to use it I get the error message "Unknown fingerprint. try again". Well, I think I'll try again...... with a different reader. The Verifi P2000 fingerprint I bough work much better. Unfortunately neither tells me if it is a Windows Biometric Framework "Secure Sensor". This means the biometric data it uses is securely stored in a hardware-backed TPM which is preferred over using software only solution.
customer_reviews.author: Robert M

customer_reviews.title: Good way to add fingerprint reader to laptop.
customer_reviews.text: I love touch or face ID with many of my smart products, making passwords and logins easier, but when looking for a gaming laptop biometrics seems to be in short supply. It's amazing how almost any ultrabook will have a biometric system, but expensive gaming laptops don't seem to be able to add that security and ease of use. So for my MSI GS65 I added this to use Windows Hello. I really enjoy the ability to touch unlock my PC. It sticks out slightly but isn't that awkward or intrusive. The additional feature that you can remove and carry on your keychain to be used with other computers is nice as well.
customer_reviews.author: Mak82k

customer_reviews.title: FALSE SECURITY
customer_reviews.text: When installed, Windows Hello makes you set up a pin number anyway in order to make the device to work, and when you start the computer it gives you different options to sign in other than fingerprint. If somebody steals your pin number or password, then they have the option to sign in with that pin number or with a password, leaving the fingerprint feature just as a faster way to sign in, but no a real security feature. Being that the case, I believe a security key would be more secure.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon's Client

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work well
customer_reviews.text: Something to know up front if you are planning to use this product with Windows Hello. You get three tries, and then you have to enter a PIN or password. Unfortunately, most of the time this product does not recognize a fingerprint within three tries. Every time you even barely touch it counts as a try, so first you have to carefully line up your finger. Then touch it. Then hope it works. So far it has worked three times out of the fifteen or so times I've tried it. When it works it works great, but it is very unreliable. I would seek a better solution with a larger touch surface.
customer_reviews.author: emonk

customer_reviews.title: Works with Windows 10 Hello
customer_reviews.text: The Fingerprint Key Reader is plug-and-play with Windows 10. No driver download needed. Once plugged in, you can set up Windows 10 Hello to scan fingers. I set up for 4 fingers. The scanner always recognizes the fingers I set up the first scan. I tried using others fingers. They were rejected as I expected. When Windows is locked, the blue LED light is turned on. Once you sign into Windows the blue LED light turned off. Very few times the scanner is not active while Windows is locked (no blue light). If this happens, just unplug and plug it back in.
customer_reviews.author: Green Dragon

customer_reviews.title: Thumbprint recognition failed in a month of use
customer_reviews.text: Worked well initially, meaning for about a month. After which it is recognised as a USB device but does not detect your fingerprints. The 2 stars are for it did work out of the ackagaing, and that it is an easy install, plug it in and it picks up its drivers I have tried installing drivers from Kensington I have tried 2 different win 10 machines with USB 3 and 2. I have even,tried working with the registry and management policy of my win 10 to no avail. Currently (2 weeks) waiting for a reply from the Kensington group.
customer_reviews.author: Qu

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, but on my HP laptop...
customer_reviews.text: Easy installation on Windows 10. However, there is an issue on my HP Spectre 360x, which is a computer problem, but Kensington needs to take some responsibility here also. This laptop (and maybe others that have USB Type C ports) powers the fingerprint reader all the time, even when the computer is powered off and the charging cable is removed. If left plugged in, the fingerprint reader kills the battery, although slowly. Admittedly, this is an HP problem (one of many), but Kensington and other accessory makers need to encourage HP and help to fix it.
customer_reviews.author: R. Tatum

customer_reviews.title: True Plug & Play on Windows 10
customer_reviews.text: I went through two Verifi F5100 readers that simply would not work on Windows 10 and decided to give this reader at 1/5 the cost a try. Glad I did. It set up perfectly with Windows Hello; every touch was recognized. In less than two minutes this unit was working perfectly on login. Kensington always made great products for my Macs, and now that I have given up on Apple computers, the quality is still there for Windows.
customer_reviews.author: terrycts

customer_reviews.title: Fast sensor but poor quality plastic
customer_reviews.text: This item worked great at first but for $50 I would have expected it to last longer. The enclosure for the sensor opens and crack way too easy and if it does it interferes with the way the sensor works
customer_reviews.author: Garrett Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Very decent fingerprint reader. Only complaint is you need to make sure you clean the appropriate finger before scanning each time or the oily prints build up on the scanner and causes it not to correctly read print. I use alcohol pad on finger and scanner prior to scanning finger and it reads each and every time. Otherwise very good fingerprint reader. Win 10 picked it up and seconds later it worked. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Brad Glasser

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the Kensington Verimark Reader for a couple of months now and am very pleased. It was very easy to install...Windows picked it up immediately and installed it. I have found it to be very accurate and quick. The size is also very nice. I keep it in one of the USB ports on the side of my laptop. It logs me into Roboform and MSecure very quickly. All in all I believe that it was a very good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: GWA

customer_reviews.title: High security made easy
customer_reviews.text: OK, I just plain old LOVE this dongle! I have set it up to work on all my Windows 10 computers; you can easily plug it in or take it out whenever you want. It unlocks the computer as fast as pretty much any Android phone. It is backwards compatible with Windows 8 and 7. If you aren't at least on 7, I'd advise upgrading as older versions are very secure anyway. Security Tip: It requires that you set up a "PIN". In Windows 10, your PIN can include alphanumeric characters. I'd suggest doing that as you are basically setting up a highly securey password.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch10

customer_reviews.title: Very sensitive reader - driver outdated
customer_reviews.text: Installation was a bit frustrating since the driver provided on the VeriMark website no longer works with Win10. However, if you enable driver updates through Windows Update, Microsoft will install a compatible driver. Once installed, though, the function is perfect. A quick setup through Windows Hello and I can now log in effortlessly. The reader is more sensitive and faster than typical built-in laptop readers I've used and provides instant response with just one light touch.
customer_reviews.author: Beazlebub

customer_reviews.title: You have to be a genius to setup
customer_reviews.text: Ok, due to windows 10 being slightly different on every PC, even when using the same installation and same build, the installation of this fingerprint reader can vary from a breeze to a hellish nightmare. My first PC had the most trouble, because "windows hello" just absolutely would not work, no matter what was done. If the fingerprint reader could somehow use its own software and ignore windows hello, it would probably work way better.
customer_reviews.author: Godslayer333

customer_reviews.title: Works with Windows Hello and Chrome + LastPass
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, I had to take out a tech support chat session to get it to work. Plug-and-Play apparently didn't automatically install the driver. I tried two other mini fingerprint readers. But neither of them worked. My reviews of them explain the issues I encountered. Mini USB Fingerprint Reader PQI My Lockey 360°  Eikon Mini Fingerprint Reader  I've been using the Verifi P2000 Premium Metal Fingerprint Reader on a couple of my machines. Both Windows Hello and with Chrome+LastPass work with this reader. However, this fingerprint reader is tethered to a rather long cord (which I didn't want on my laptop).
customer_reviews.author: CalvinDale

customer_reviews.title: Flawed
customer_reviews.text: My biggest complaint with this product is it changes its keys when it moves from computer to computer. So i set it up on my google account, Then when i took it to work and tried to use it google said it didnt recognize the key. Works fine as only a pc finger print reader for windows hello. Unless your using this only as a finger print reader i sugjest a yubikey instead.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: This thing rocks! It keeps the kids from seeing my PIN code.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my family takes in foster kids, the foster kids like to watch my little sister typing her PIN code, and sometimes me they will sneak up just to see your PIN code when you think they're not around. Now that I have the finger print scanner, I never have to use any passwords or PIN codes. When they need administrative approval I just use my finger. It does exactly what I want it to, it has no issues. Overall I'm an extremely satisfied customer.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly easy setup
customer_reviews.text: The hardest thing about installing the device was removing the protective cover. It fits tight! I plugged it into a USB 2 port and about 15 seconds later, I was registering fingerprints for Windows Hello. I haven't tried it with other Windows software. I have tried it in Linux. It's recognized by libfprint, but my source-based Linux distro won't compile the Qt5 GUI.
customer_reviews.author: TCTxPhoenix

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product. It was a pretty easy set up ...
customer_reviews.text: Very nice product. It was a pretty easy set up as well. the small build of this makes it easy to take with you, or to leave it in use without having to leave a bulky usb scanner hanging of your computer. you can add multiple finger prints ( a friend , family, or just all your own fingers). Usually reads mine the first or second try. for the price I would say this is a good buy and I would recommend it to anyone who wants to make their passwords faster and easier.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and simple to use.
customer_reviews.text: The fingerprint reader was very easy to install. I just insert it into the USB port on the side of my keyboard, waited for a few seconds and the driver installed automatically. Then just search for "Windows Hello", run the fingerprint recognition program to collect my fingerprint (very similar process to how iPhone used to collect fingerprints), and that was it. Log in using the fingerprint reader was very very fast. Almost instantaneous. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Paulo Panda

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but only if you have Windows Hello
customer_reviews.text: I bough this to use with a 4-year old laptop and it wasn't compatible since the laptop didn't support Windows Hello (even though it was running the current release of Windows 10). So I decided to use it with my 1-year old business laptop and it works great. Makes logging into Windows and LastPass a breeze. I highly recommend it, but be sure you have a PC with Windows Hello.
customer_reviews.author: Counselor

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and efficient for windows 10 hello setup
customer_reviews.text: Works very reliably. Much quicker than a pin or password. For example, when screen is locked on windows 10 (eg when you’ve been away from the computer for awhile), touching the fingerprint reader both brings the screen out of powersave and unlocks the screen. Setup is built into windows 10, so all you need to do is plug it in, wait for device to be automatically installed, then go to the settings screen for sign in options. There’s a button for set up fingerprint sensor.
customer_reviews.author: NotTheDude

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and Easy
customer_reviews.text: Overall, the product works well with my HP laptop. Once in awhile, it doesn't recognize my fingerprint, but the solution is to unplug the USB and plug it back. It might be that I keep the USB connected at all times, unsure. *Edited* Out of the blue the dongle stopped working and became overheated when plugged into laptop.
customer_reviews.author: sheuntell

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I am a big skeptic and don't give out too many glowing reviews but this thing works right out of the box, recognized by Win 10 immediately, and wanted to register my fingerprint. It registered rapidly. I only wish it had a larger fingerprint surface to be able to detect a larger portion of your print. I have been using it now for a couple of months and have never missed a stroke. I have occasionally tried other UNregistered fingers and it refuses them. Much better than the Samsung phone fingerprint detection.
customer_reviews.author: esarhaddon

customer_reviews.title: This is the first fingerprint scanner for Windows that's as good as Touch ID
customer_reviews.text: Detects instantly. This is the first fingerprint scanner for Windows that's as good as Touch ID. It now works in Firefox 57 Beta if you enable U2F and USB tokens in about:config.
customer_reviews.author: Monstieur

customer_reviews.title: Great with Windows 10
customer_reviews.text: I use this exclusively with my Windows 10 desktop plugged into a USB extension "base". It works great and recognizes me pretty fast. Like almost every other fingerprint sensor out there, it does have some trouble with sweaty and wet fingers though. It is much easier to use than my old Authentic swipe strip fingerprint reader. Much easier to use since you only have to touch it, not swipe.
customer_reviews.author: Sunny

customer_reviews.title: A Game Changer
customer_reviews.text: I have bought one for each of my Windows 10 computers. It makes logging in a snap. Plus they also can be used for the Windows UAC dialog. Most of my monitors have a USB port on the side of the monitor where I plug the reader in. It's super convenient and reliably works. To reduce the chance of accidentally of installing unwanted software, I changed the Windows 10 security settings to always show the UAC prior to installing software. It's not a setting I would choose unless I had the fingerprint reader. This is one case where having the fingerprint makes me much more secure.
customer_reviews.author: Wade

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC addition to computer security
customer_reviews.text: Recently purchased all new computers -- and I wanted to added a "plus up" of security on the machines. I use DashLane for password management because I like the two-factor authentification (and encryption, etc., etc.) - this little device not only integrates with initial login into the machine but also integrates seamlessly with DashLane. So easy to install, so easy to use! Windows 10 took it immediatley with NO effort at all.
customer_reviews.author: Columbia, MD

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT works 100% of the time
customer_reviews.text: For about a year I had been using the BIO-key EcoID Fingerprint Reader I bought from amazon, it is junk, terrible performance. I decided to replace as it did not work 50% of the time. I replaced it with the Kensington VeriMark USB Fingerprint Key Reader, which I also bought from Amazon. All I needed it for, was reading fingerprints to sign into my PC. That is all it does, but it does it 100% of the time, I highly recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: J. Soler

customer_reviews.title: Works like a champ!
customer_reviews.text: Had built in fingerprint reader on old laptop and loved it. New laptop I just got did not have this option, so I purchased this and it works great. Set up on Windows 10 with Windows Hello and was seamless, works just like the built in one. So nice to tap a finger and not have to key anything to log in.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic while it worked, slowly fell apart...
customer_reviews.text: I loved this reader and even bought a replacement for the broken unit pictured. Fast, secure access to my work laptop. I travel, A Lot, for work and school and this unit's carrying mechanism broke after 4 months of daily carry. The "flush fit" of this "single-PC" unit did not keep the unit from damage since the sensor housing was at least 1/8th inch protruded from the side of the computer at all times. Tried to shim the USB Male end with a 3d print but the result is pictured. You can't beat the sensor performance, just don't expect it to last as a daily carried security measure. Investigating another FIDO key solution
customer_reviews.author: Another Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Simple Fingerprint Reader
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these for myself and one for my dad because he has a tough time remembering his passwords. I have it set up so he can log in to his computer without giving the password and I have it hooked up to a password manager (LastPass) so it requires his fingerprint to use his passwords. Great little device. I plugged mine into the USB port on my keyboard! :-)
customer_reviews.author: Ravi

customer_reviews.title: especially if your finger is dirty, greasy
customer_reviews.text: This works a treat! Sometimes you have to put your finger on it a few times, especially if your finger is dirty, greasy, or chowdered up from doing work but it sure beats remembering a bunch of passwords or pins. The same thing happens with phones though so I'm not deducting a star.
customer_reviews.author: John Wohlwend

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working in less than a few months.
customer_reviews.text: I loved this reader. However, it has become less and less reliable over time. I have cleaned it and tried re-registering finger prints multiple times. Nothing fixes the issue.
customer_reviews.author: cg5000

customer_reviews.title: Finger print reader has a reading disability
customer_reviews.text: This fingerprint reader is very handy for logging into the computer - when it works. However, it frequently won't read the fingerprint and we must still use the old password system to log in. I try cleaning and re entering the fingerprints, which did not help. I did not call tech support.
customer_reviews.author: Motorstuff

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm for Windows 10
customer_reviews.text: I plug this fingerprint reader to the USB 3.0 ports of my monitor and it works after I installed the driver. (Device manager shows "Unknown device", but Windows 10 can automatically download and install its driver by "update driver", so not a huge issue) I logged my fingerprint under Windows Hello settings, and it recognizes my index finger correctly. I have used this fingerprint reader for several logins with no problem at all.
customer_reviews.author: czhang

customer_reviews.title: Excellent until it falls apart
customer_reviews.text: I very much like this reader. But... I've had it for less than six months and it's starting to fall apart. The bezel around the reading surface has fallen off and now the reading surface looks like it may come off soon. Such a shame, as I like it other wise.
customer_reviews.author: smw

customer_reviews.title: Works great, once installed
customer_reviews.text: Installation on one laptop was plug and play. The other, I had to find the software/drivers, but then it worked great. Setting up the fingerprint scan was super easy, and it reads my fingerprint super easy. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: cellslawyer

customer_reviews.title: Was hard to open out of the box, but over all it is good
customer_reviews.text: Leaving it at one star until I can fix this. But I just took this out the box and cannot open it, I want to avoid using too much force to not break it, but honestly the lid/cover is not coming off. Seriously WTF this is annoying me. EDIT: K I got it off but had to use my teeth to unplug it, when I plug it back to it's over, it's too tight and hard to get out. This is probably cause it's brand new, but however I expect it to come off easily out of the box. The Windows Hello works, which is nice and I can sign in like I sign in on my iPad
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Best readable fingerprint scanner for the money
customer_reviews.text: use the fingerprint scanner for more protection. will be trying on laptop next. very portable, easily set up for all computer devices. my laptop built in fingerprint scanner is more fail than not
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Identifies my finger probably 10% of the time
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this fingerprint reader. It installed to my Windows 10 desktop without any issue and I was able to register my finger with Windows Hello. But trying to unlock my desktop with same finger almost never works. I've deleted and re-registered the fingerprint through Windows Hello several times, and it never seems to help. If you are used to the accuracy of a built-in laptop fingerprint reader, this is not the one for you.
customer_reviews.author: A. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Footprint.
customer_reviews.text: I love the size. I plug this into the side USB on my monitor. How nice its looks and works. Besure to download drivers off website because it stopped working for me after some update. I got the drivers and it works again. :) 1909
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Works occasionally
customer_reviews.text: This is more of a gimmick than anything. I have fingerprint detection built into my laptop, which works 95% of the time like my phone. This thing works if it feels like it, and if my finger print is absolutely clean and dry; it won't even work after washing hands. Not worth buying.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Nilsen

customer_reviews.title: It works well, priced reasonably
customer_reviews.text: Works well with Windows Hello and Dashlane. I use it every time I unlock my machine and when I use my password manager. 6 months or so with no problems. Most of the time the authentication happens under a second with the first finger press.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: It works for me with Win10 and Dell XPS 15
customer_reviews.text: Was super simple to set and it works very well for me.
customer_reviews.author: RSinChandler

customer_reviews.title: Kenington Fingerprint reader
customer_reviews.text: I use this on my Desktop and Laptop, the built fingerprint reader on my laptop doesn't work any more so it is great for that, and my desktop didn't have one at all. It's great not having to enter my login passwords anymore, Wonderful device, thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Capouch

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with Windows Hello As Advertised
customer_reviews.text: I am a technical person and this almost never unlocks a machine. I was hoping for something like what I have to unlock my mac or my iPhone, but it does not work.
customer_reviews.author: AxlF

customer_reviews.title: Wow, so fast!
customer_reviews.text: Added this to my GPD Micro PC so I could skip typing my password on the tiny keyboard. This fingerprint reader is faster and more accurate than the reader in my Thinkpad X1C6. Super impressed!
customer_reviews.author: Eric B

customer_reviews.title: its just finer for an international shipment
customer_reviews.text: The shipment from Illinois to Bangalore took 7 days.Aramex people asked me to upload the id documents for the customs clearance and got the customs clearance in two days.The shipment tracking in Amazon was lagging, in Aramex site tracking provided detailed update about the transit . This product worked without any driver.Windows 10 fingerprint initial setup is very easy. I didn't face any issues in login using this product. VeriMark addon software VeriMark password manager initially it didn't worked, i cleared browser cache and saved password then it started working. Website signon just swipe your finger it will do the rest.I this product is expensive compared other finger print reader but the accuracy is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE the product NOT the price
customer_reviews.text: I love the product not the price - You can find a USB fingerprint reader from $20-$30 for some reason this one is $7+ more. Only reason I decided on this one was because it was black and it goes with my system better. Works great with Windows 10 no issues. Never had a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Bianca

customer_reviews.title: Recommended 5 Stars
customer_reviews.text: The item is excellent. The only thing that makes me really concern is the delivery of the package. The delivery person basically placed the package on my front porch, not thinking that it could be blown away by the wind since it weights less than a pound. The person could have placed it in my mailbox or inside my storm door . I guess common sense is not common after all.Anyway, it's a learning experience.
customer_reviews.author: Rossman59

customer_reviews.title: What a time saver!
customer_reviews.text: Using this on a desktop computer with an Asus X-99-A USB 3.1 motherboard and Windows 10. Using it to scan a thumbprint, and so far no problems. Sure beats having to type in passwords. Prefer the surface area of a thumbprint over a fingerprint for consistency in scans.
customer_reviews.author: DBH

customer_reviews.title: Quick fingerprint reader! But reader "stings" your finger
customer_reviews.text: The device was easy to install and was easy to use and included a keychain holder which was pretty hard to remove the reader from (i injured my nail by trying to pry it out) and the reader makes your finger "sting" when you use it to unlock your computer
customer_reviews.author: Miguel L

customer_reviews.title: Great fingerprint reader!
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly with Windows 10 and I have zero issues with missed reads unless I touch it in a way that's different from when I trained it.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Cuyler

customer_reviews.title: Good concept, Bad build
customer_reviews.text: The build quality is not up to par especially for the amount I paid. The initial unit came apart. Kensington replaced it through their support page. A tech support suggested to use super glue to glue back the border piece that kept falling apart but that failed tremendously as the glue seeped out to the biometric reader. Third reader (2nd replacement part) is now falling apart and is barely a month old. Can I just get refunded? This is frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: A. Abdi

customer_reviews.title: Really fast!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome fingerprint reader that works great with Windows Hello! Real easy setup and very fast scanning gets me logged into my laptop within 1-2 seconds every time with a simple tap of my finger. Seems to be well made with good quality materials and does not feel cheap.
customer_reviews.author: B. Schuck

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use but sporadic functionality
customer_reviews.text: Fairly easy to install and the to configure with Windows Hello. I find, however that occasionally when the system comes out of sleep state, the reader is not active and does not allow me to log in (need to use password instead). Reader accuracy is somewhat sporadic when my skin is dry.
customer_reviews.author: Lee_Z

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up. Makes log into your computer simple and fast.
customer_reviews.text: I have set up three of these for myself and purchased two additional to give as gifts. They work very well and are easy to set up under windows 10. They operate nearly identically to the newest iPhone and android fingerprint sensor's. A quick tap is all it takes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works 25% of the time
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to make the process of logging in easier. Turns out is verified my fingerprint correctly 25% of the time. Even tried re-enrolling my fingerprint multiple times. Much more hassle than it's worth.
customer_reviews.author: EvanJ

customer_reviews.title: not durable, not reliable
customer_reviews.text: It lasted a bit over a year but now the plastic shell has broken. It often doesn't recognize me and I have to enter a PIN to log on. Might as well just enter a PIN at the login screen.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Used to work great - I think windows changed something makes Fingerprint fail.
customer_reviews.text: This worked great when I first got it for months. Now it is has become too sensitive and Windows only gives two tries. The original setup was long an took many readings. I set it up again after beginning to fail and Windows only looked at three or so readings.
customer_reviews.author: James G. Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Easy, Fast and Just Works!
customer_reviews.text: Checkout the video I made. You'll have this up and working in under 5 minutes. Really nothing to say about this. You plug it in, setup the finger you want to use and it just works! Easy!
customer_reviews.author: Michael H. Pettit

customer_reviews.title: It works well once setup!
customer_reviews.text: The problem is that it takes several hours to learn all the steps! Windows Hello is Not easy to setup. I use LastPass Password Manager and it does Not work everytime! It is probably a problem with LastPass, I assume!
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, works every time.
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed for my older desktop PC. Installed on one of the spare USB ports, Windows 10 recognized it right off and it reads the fingerprint consistently. I did register two fingers twice each so it had multiple readings on file. Many of the apps use it as alternative log on that I didn't even think about, bonus!
customer_reviews.author: gooddog

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: It is very small but most of all, it didn't work with my Home PC that runs Windows 10. Returned it
customer_reviews.author: A Catlover In Colorado

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Plug'n'Play, no drivers needed. Detected instantly on Windows 10, it's fast and very accurate. It also works great for other application, not only Windows Hello.
customer_reviews.author: Marius

customer_reviews.title: This is the third one I've purchased. First one was nearly a year ago, and I've never had a problem
customer_reviews.text: This is my third fingerprint key. They set up like they are supposed to, and have immediately been recognized by the windows system. I bought the first one nearly a year ago, and they are continuing to work, as they are supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: EN

customer_reviews.title: Ok fingerprint reader
customer_reviews.text: It was difficult to install. Following the directions provided it took many tries to get my fingerprint loaded. I had to restart the process 3 times before I succeeded. Using the device to logon is frustrating. Placement of my finger must be very precise or it is not recognized. I find it faster to logon using my pin.
customer_reviews.author: Jack L.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome gift
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my teenage son for Christmas and he absolutely loves it! Now he can log in to multiple devices (other than his phone) using his fingerprint.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: After getting 'Hello' to install on my computer, and ...
customer_reviews.text: After getting 'Hello' to install on my computer, and after research on the web, 'Hello' finished setting-up itself, and the Kensington device now works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: GraysonS

customer_reviews.title: Works great with Windows 10 Hello
customer_reviews.text: This works perfectly with Windows 10 Hello. That is all I use it for and it's nicer than entering my password each time.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Convenient security
customer_reviews.text: Plugged it in, rebooted to get it to load the driver, and it worked. Saves me typing in password, mandated by IT.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Latta

customer_reviews.title: Works flawlessly
customer_reviews.text: This reader works absolutely perfectly, NO false negatives. It is a tap style reader as well, no need to swipe your finger over the surface. Works with Windows Hello and authenticates to Lastpass too. Strongly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Simon Karmentian

customer_reviews.title: works on windows not on mac
customer_reviews.text: FYI this works on windows perfectly, not on mac. Also does not work with windows administrator accounts by the inherent design of windows.
customer_reviews.author: The human

customer_reviews.title: Works great on Windows 10 and Dashlane
customer_reviews.text: Purchased product for my desktop and it works great, reads instantly. Took 60 seconds to set up. Integrates with Windows hello which allows it to unlock a variety of apps including Dashlane.
customer_reviews.author: Drew H.

customer_reviews.title: Exceeds my expectations
customer_reviews.text: Spoiled by fingerprint logon on my Thinkpad X1 Carbon laptop, I bought the Kensington reader for my Lenovo desktop. (Both machines have Windows 10.) After a brief hiccup in getting the computer to recognize the device, I've found it to work perfectly; it's even more dependable in reading a finger than the Thinkpad. It lives in one of the USB ports on my Das Keyboard, making it very convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce C.

customer_reviews.title: worth every single penny
customer_reviews.text: Have to use a minimum of 12 characters at work. Was so tired of typing that password in over and over and over. This little magic device was easy to install and easy to configure. Works great with Windows Hello. Where has this been all my life. Tempted to buy one for home as well even though my home pc just uses a Windows Hello pin.
customer_reviews.author: Steven M Lane

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: This has not failed me, and makes signing into the computer relatively secure and quick. It works.
customer_reviews.author: Racerp

customer_reviews.title: easy to setup (win 10) & works fast
customer_reviews.text: my work requires us to lock our pc every time we leave. This reader makes it so I don't have to punch in my password throughout the day!
customer_reviews.author: W

customer_reviews.title: Not work on my Win 7 Notebook
customer_reviews.text: Tried two VeriMark devices on my Windows 7 Notebook. Following assistance from Kensington and Microsoft Tech's, VeriMark was still not recognized. Presumably a VeriMark Driver issue. Returned to Amazon. Subsequently installed Verify P2000 Fingerprint reader, which works great on my computer.
customer_reviews.author: J. Shouse

customer_reviews.title: Gets hot
customer_reviews.text: While this was very easy to incall and it works well, I find it gets fairly hot. Not sure if it's defective or just supposed to work that way m
customer_reviews.author: NOLATechy

customer_reviews.title: Best fingerprint reader for saving time rather than typing in your password every time!
customer_reviews.text: I use this fingerprint reader for logging in on a windows pc with windows hello! Setting up is pretty easy and quick!
customer_reviews.author: Corey Chisholm

customer_reviews.title: Setup was super easy. Driver auto installed on Windows 10
customer_reviews.text: Working well so far. It unlocks the pc very quickly and on the first attempt. Will update review if my experience changes over time. Setup was super easy. Driver auto installed on Windows 10. It was completely plug and play.
customer_reviews.author: kyle

customer_reviews.title: Fine
customer_reviews.text: Does the job, doesn’t require much maintenance or skill to install. The performance however is way below what we can be used to from the smartphone world... a lot of reads fail to no apparent reason at all
customer_reviews.author: Joao Mendes

customer_reviews.title: Small but big enough to recognize fingerprints
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and Windows Hello recognizes it, a little pricey but definitely worth the buy. This has made my log in a lot easier and it’s small enough to travel with.
customer_reviews.author: Saul Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: So good I bought one for work
customer_reviews.text: Setting this up at home was a breeze, and I definitely recommend it for personal use. At work, it required a bit more research, but it has definitely made signing into my computer much, much easier and faster. Have not had any problems so far, and I definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob H

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Plug and play, just put it in and enrolled a fingerprint and it works great! reads quickly from different angles, super pleased with it!
customer_reviews.author: Z. Raizen

customer_reviews.title: Works well on Windows 10 nice light up LED when in use.
customer_reviews.text: Worked well on my windows 10 machine after looking at the instructions on their site. No drivers needed. Works nice and fast like my s8 phone! It's a little on the pricey side for what it does but it's good quality.
customer_reviews.author: SuperSpaceshipX

product_meta.title: Kensington VeriMark USB Fingerprint Key Reader - Windows Hello, FIDO U2F, Anti-Spoofing (K67977WW),Black
product_meta.description: Style:For Single PC'sInnovation, quality, and trust have made Kensington the standard in device security for more than 25 years. Kensington is expanding that expertise to data security by introducing the world's first fingerprint security key to support Windows Hello and Fast Identity Online (FIDO) universal 2nd-factor authentication (U2F) – the Mark Fingerprint Key. Engineered to provide simple, fast, and secure Windows logon and a seamless two factor authentication experience, the Mark Fingerprint Key protects against unauthorized access on compromised devices, while also offering unprecedented cybersecurity for today's cloud-based world.
feature_bullets: Fingerprint reader with advanced fingerprint technology combines superior biometric performance and 360° readability as well as anti-spoofing protection

Login on your Windows computer using Microsoft's built-in Windows Hello login feature with just your fingerprint, no need to remember usernames and passwords; can be used with up to 10 different fingerprints so multiple users can login to the same computer

One-way conversion of biometric data into a proprietary template format prevents re-creation, reverse-engineering or use for unintended purposes, thereby protecting the user from identity theft; All biometric data is encrypted and digitally signed using strong 256-bit advanced encryption standard and transport layer security technologies to prevent eavesdropping, tampering or fraud
Works in any PC (including Surface Pro 7/6/5/4) or docking station USB A port (USB 2. 0, 3. 0, 3. 1); also works in a USB-C port with a USB-C male to USB-A female adapter (not included)
FIDO U2F Certified - your fingerprint can protect your cloud based accounts such as Google, Dropbox, GitHub and Facebook with FIDO second-factor authentication (requires Chrome browser)
Compatible with Windows Hello, Windows 10, 8 and 7; NOT compatible with Mac OS or Chrome OS; Compact design easily attaches to a standard key ring for convenient portability

Password Manager Compatibility supports popular tools, like Dashlane, LastPass (Premium), Keeper (Premium) and Roboform, to allow the fingerprint to authenticate and automatically fill in usernames and passwords for websites.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars705 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
